<?php

class ReCaptchaSocket {
    private $socket;

    public function __construct($host, $port) {
        $this->socket = fsockopen('ssl://' . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);
        if (!$this->socket) {
            throw new Exception("Socket error: $errstr ($errno)");
        }
    }

    public function write($data) {
        fwrite($this->socket, $data);
    }

    public function read() {
        $response = '';
        while (!feof($this->socket)) {
            $response .= fgets($this->socket, 4096);
        }
        return $response;
    }

    public function close() {
        fclose($this->socket);
    }
}

class ReCaptchaRequestParameters {
    public $secret;
    public $response;
    public $remoteip;

    public function __construct($secret, $response, $remoteip = null) {
        $this->secret = $secret;
        $this->response = $response;
        $this->remoteip = $remoteip;
    }

    public function toPostData() {
        $postData = http_build_query([
            'secret' => $this->secret,
            'response' => $this->response,
            'remoteip' => $this->remoteip
        ]);
        return $postData;
    }
}

class ReCaptchaSocketPostRequestMethod {
    private $socket;
    private const RECAPTCHA_HOST = 'www.google.com';
    private const SITE_VERIFY_PATH = '/recaptcha/api/siteverify';
    private const BAD_REQUEST = '{"success": false, "error-codes": ["bad-request"]}';
    private const BAD_RESPONSE = '{"success": false, "error-codes": ["bad-response"]}';

    public function __construct(ReCaptchaSocket $socket = null) {
        $this->socket = $socket ?? new ReCaptchaSocket(self::RECAPTCHA_HOST, 443);
    }

    public function submit(ReCaptchaRequestParameters $params): string {
        $postData = $params->toPostData();
        $request = "POST " . self::SITE_VERIFY_PATH . " HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: " . self::RECAPTCHA_HOST . "\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($postData) . "\r\n";
        $request .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";
        $request .= $postData;

        $this->socket->write($request);
        $response = $this->socket->read();
        $this->socket->close();

        $headerBody = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        if (count($headerBody) != 2) {
            return self::BAD_RESPONSE;
        }

        return $headerBody[1];
    }
}

?>

<?php

namespace MyNamespace;

use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Log\LogLevel;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface
{
    private $logger;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger = null)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: ($scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $path = $uri->getPath();
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $method = $request->getMethod();
        $headers = $request->getHeaders();
        $body = $request->getBody()->getContents();

        $this->logger->info("Sending request to {$host}{$path}");

        $fp = fsockopen(($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);
        if (!$fp) {
            $this->logger->error("Unable to connect to {$host}: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
            throw new \Exception("Unable to connect to server: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
        }

        $requestHeaders = "{$method} {$path}" . ($query ? "?{$query}" : '') . " HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $requestHeaders .= "Host: {$host}\r\n";
        foreach ($headers as $name => $values) {
            $requestHeaders .= "{$name}: " . implode(', ', $values) . "\r\n";
        }
        $requestHeaders .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($body) . "\r\n";
        $requestHeaders .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";
        $requestHeaders .= $body;

        fwrite($fp, $requestHeaders);

        $responseHeaders = '';
        $responseBody = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $line = fgets($fp, 4096);
            if ($line === "\r\n") {
                break;
            }
            $responseHeaders .= $line;
        }
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $responseBody .= fgets($fp, 4096);
        }
        fclose($fp);

        $this->logger->debug("Received response from {$host}{$path}");

        list($version, $statusCode, $reasonPhrase) = explode(' ', trim($responseHeaders), 3);

        $response = new \GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response($statusCode, $this->parseHeaders($responseHeaders), $responseBody, $version, $reasonPhrase);

        return $response;
    }

    private function parseHeaders($headerString): array
    {
        $headers = [];
        $headerLines = explode("\r\n", $headerString);
        array_shift($headerLines); // Remove the HTTP status line
        foreach ($headerLines as $line) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
            $headers[trim($name)][] = trim($value);
        }
        return $headers;
    }
}

?>

<?php

namespace MyNamespace;

use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Log\LogLevel;

class SocketHttpClient implements ClientInterface
{
    private $logger;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger = null)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();
        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: ($scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $path = $uri->getPath();
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $method = $request->getMethod();
        $headers = $request->getHeaders();
        $body = $request->getBody()->getContents();

        $this->logger && $this->logger->info("Sending request to {$scheme}://{$host}{$path}");

        $fp = fsockopen(($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $host, $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);
        if (!$fp) {
            $this->logger && $this->logger->error("Socket error: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
            throw new \Exception("Socket error: {$errstr} ({$errno})");
        }

        $requestHeaders = "{$method} {$path}" . ($query ? "?{$query}" : '') . " HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $requestHeaders .= "Host: {$host}\r\n";
        foreach ($headers as $name => $values) {
            $requestHeaders .= "{$name}: " . implode(', ', $values) . "\r\n";
        }
        $requestHeaders .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($body) . "\r\n";
        $requestHeaders .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";
        $requestHeaders .= $body;

        fwrite($fp, $requestHeaders);

        $responseHeaders = '';
        $responseBody = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $line = fgets($fp, 4096);
            if ($line === "\r\n") {
                break;
            }
            $responseHeaders .= $line;
        }
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $responseBody .= fgets($fp, 4096);
        }
        fclose($fp);

        $this->logger && $this->logger->debug("Received response headers:\n{$responseHeaders}");
        $this->logger && $this->logger->debug("Received response body:\n{$responseBody}");

        $response = $this->createResponse($responseHeaders, $responseBody);

        return $response;
    }

    private function createResponse($headers, $body): ResponseInterface
    {
        $response = new \GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response();
        $headerLines = explode("\r\n", trim($headers));
        $statusLine = array_shift($headerLines);
        list($protocol, $statusCode, $reasonPhrase) = explode(' ', $statusLine, 3);
        $response = $response->withStatus((int)$statusCode, $reasonPhrase);

        foreach ($headerLines as $headerLine) {
            list($name, $value) = explode(':', $headerLine, 2);
            $response = $response->withAddedHeader(trim($name), trim($value));
        }

        $response->getBody()->write($body);

        return $response;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a function that implements a RabbitMQ consumer in PHP to process messages from a specified queue.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, and starts consuming messages. It processes each message by printing its content and acknowledging it. The consumer stops when it receives a 'quit' message or when the channel is no longer consuming. The function includes proper cleanup by closing the channel and connection upon shutdown.

Input:
- $host (string): The hostname of the RabbitMQ server
- $port (int): The port number of the RabbitMQ server
- $user (string): The username for RabbitMQ authentication
- $pass (string): The password for RabbitMQ authentication
- $vhost (string): The virtual host to connect to
- $exchange (string): The name of the exchange to declare
- $queue (string): The name of the queue to declare and consume from
- $consumerTag (string): The identifier for this consumer

Output: None (The function processes messages asynchronously and does not return a value)
matched_results:
<?php
require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function rabbitMQConsumer($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $exchange, $queue, $consumerTag) {
    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
    $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
    $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

    $callback = function ($msg) use ($channel) {
        echo 'Received: ', $msg->body, PHP_EOL;
        if ($msg->body === 'quit') {
            $msg->ack();
            $channel->basic_cancel($msg->get('consumer_tag'));
        } else {
            $msg->ack();
        }
    };

    $channel->basic_consume($queue, $consumerTag, false, false, false, false, $callback);

    register_shutdown_function(function () use ($channel, $connection) {
        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();
    });

    while ($channel->is_consuming()) {
        $channel->wait();
    }
}
?>

Task Description: Create a RabbitMQ consumer class in PHP that connects to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, and processes incoming messages until a termination signal is received.

Class Description: The RabbitMQConsumer class handles the consumption of messages from a RabbitMQ queue. It establishes a connection to the server, sets up the necessary queue and exchange, processes messages, and provides shutdown functionality.

Attributes:
- msgCount: [int] - Tracks the number of messages processed
- startTime: [float|null] - Records the start time of message processing
- conn: [AMQPStreamConnection] - Holds the RabbitMQ server connection
- ch: [AMQPChannel] - Represents the communication channel
- exchange: [string] - Name of the exchange to bind to
- queue: [string] - Name of the queue to consume from
- consumer_tag: [string] - Identifier for the consumer (empty in this implementation)

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the RabbitMQ connection, channel, exchange, and queue
- process_message([AMQPMessage] $msg) -> [void] - Processes incoming messages and handles termination signal
- startConsuming() -> [void] - Starts consuming messages from the queue
- shutdown() -> [void] - Closes the channel and connection cleanly

Task Description: Create a PHP function that implements a RabbitMQ consumer to process messages from a specified queue, with the ability to acknowledge or reject messages based on their content, and properly handle connection shutdown.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them together, and starts consuming messages. It processes each message by acknowledging "good" messages and rejecting others. If the message body is "quit", it stops consuming. The function includes proper cleanup by closing the channel and connection on shutdown.

Input:
- $host: string - RabbitMQ server hostname
- $port: int - RabbitMQ server port
- $user: string - RabbitMQ username
- $pass: string - RabbitMQ password  
- $vhost: string - RabbitMQ virtual host
- $exchange: string - Exchange name to bind to
- $queue: string - Queue name to consume from
- $consumerTag: string - Identifier for this consumer

Output: None (This is a long-running consumer process that handles messages asynchronously)

<?php
function rabbitMQConsumer($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $exchange, $queue, $consumerTag) {
    require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';
    use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
    use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
    $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
    $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

    $callback = function ($msg) use ($channel) {
        if ($msg->body === 'quit') {
            $msg->ack();
            $channel->basic_cancel($msg->delivery_info['consumer_tag']);
            $channel->close();
            $channel->getConnection()->close();
            exit;
        } elseif ($msg->body === 'good') {
            $msg->ack();
        } else {
            $msg->reject();
        }
    };

    $channel->basic_consume($queue, $consumerTag, false, false, false, false, $callback);

    register_shutdown_function(function () use ($channel, $connection) {
        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();
    });

    while ($channel->is_consuming()) {
        $channel->wait();
    }
}
?>

Task Description: Implement a PHP function that establishes a RabbitMQ consumer to process messages from a specified queue. The function should handle connection setup, message consumption, and proper cleanup.

Function Description: The function `start_rabbitmq_consumer` initializes a RabbitMQ consumer that connects to a specified server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, and starts consuming messages. It processes each message using a callback function and handles graceful shutdown.

Input:
- `$host` (string): RabbitMQ server hostname or IP address
- `$port` (int): RabbitMQ server port number
- `$user` (string): RabbitMQ username for authentication
- `$pass` (string): RabbitMQ password for authentication
- `$vhost` (string): RabbitMQ virtual host
- `$exchange` (string): Name of the exchange to bind to
- `$queue` (string): Name of the queue to consume messages from

Output: None (The function runs continuously until terminated or until receiving a 'quit' message)
matched_results:
<?php
require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function start_rabbitmq_consumer($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $exchange, $queue) {
    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
    $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
    $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

    $callback = function ($msg) {
        echo 'Received ', $msg->body, "\n";
        if ($msg->body === 'quit') {
            $msg->ack();
            throw new Exception('Quit command received');
        }
        $msg->ack();
    };

    $channel->basic_qos(null, 1, null);
    $channel->basic_consume($queue, '', false, false, false, false, $callback);

    try {
        while ($channel->is_consuming()) {
            $channel->wait();
        }
    } catch (Exception $e) {
        echo 'Consumer stopped: ', $e->getMessage(), "\n";
    } finally {
        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();
    }
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that consumes messages from a RabbitMQ queue using headers-based routing. The function should establish a connection to RabbitMQ, declare an exchange and queue, bind the queue with specified headers, and process incoming messages with a callback function.

Function Description: The function `consume_rabbitmq_messages` connects to a RabbitMQ server, sets up a headers-based exchange, declares a temporary queue, binds the queue with the provided headers, and starts consuming messages. It processes each message using a callback function that displays the message body and headers. The function handles timeouts gracefully and cleans up resources after processing.

Input: 
- `$headers` (array): An array of strings in the format "key=value" representing the headers to bind the queue with.

Output: 
- Returns `true` if the function executes successfully.
- Returns `false` if the input headers are empty.
- Outputs message details to stdout and may write errors to stderr.

<?php
function consume_rabbitmq_messages($headers) {
    if (empty($headers)) {
        return false;
    }

    require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';

    $connection = new \PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection('localhost', 5672, 'user', 'password');
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $exchange_name = 'headers_exchange';
    $channel->exchange_declare($exchange_name, 'headers', false, true, false);

    list($queue_name, ,) = $channel->queue_declare("", false, false, true, false);

    $binding_headers = [];
    foreach ($headers as $header) {
        list($key, $value) = explode('=', $header);
        $binding_headers[$key] = $value;
    }

    $channel->queue_bind($queue_name, $exchange_name, '', $binding_headers);

    $callback = function ($msg) {
        echo "Message Body: " . $msg->body . PHP_EOL;
        echo "Headers: " . json_encode($msg->get('application_headers')->getNativeData()) . PHP_EOL;
    };

    $channel->basic_consume($queue_name, '', false, true, false, false, $callback);

    while ($channel->is_consuming()) {
        $channel->wait();
    }

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();

    return true;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that sends multiple messages to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and measures the execution time for the operation.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, creates a temporary queue, sends a specified number of messages with the given content, and returns the total time taken to complete the operation. Each message is sent through a newly created channel, and the temporary queue is automatically deleted after use.

Input:
- $max_messages: [int] - The number of messages to send.
- $host: [string] - The hostname or IP address of the RabbitMQ server.
- $port: [int] - The port number of the RabbitMQ server.
- $user: [string] - The username for RabbitMQ authentication.
- $pass: [string] - The password for RabbitMQ authentication.
- $vhost: [string] - The virtual host to connect to on the RabbitMQ server.
- $message_body: [string] - The content of the message to be sent.

Output:
- [float] - The total execution time in seconds for sending all messages, or false if the connection fails.

    $start_time = microtime(true);

    try {

Task Description: Implement a function that sends a delayed message to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and the PhpAmqpLib library. The function should establish a connection to RabbitMQ, declare a delayed exchange and queue, and publish a message with a specified delay time.

Function Description: The function `send_delayed_message` sends a message to a RabbitMQ queue with a specified delay. It uses a delayed exchange to achieve the delay functionality. The function handles the connection setup, exchange and queue declaration, message creation with delay headers, and cleanup of resources.

Input:
- `$message_content` [string] - The content of the message to be sent.
- `$delay_ms` [int] - The delay time in milliseconds before the message is delivered to the queue.

Output: None. The function does not return any value but publishes the message to the specified RabbitMQ queue with the given delay.

Note: The function assumes the existence of a `config.php` file containing the RabbitMQ connection parameters (HOST, PORT, USER, PASS, VHOST).

<?php
require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';
use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;
use PhpAmqpLib\Wire\AMQPTable;

function send_delayed_message($message_content, $delay_ms) {
    require 'config.php';
    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($HOST, $PORT, $USER, $PASS, $VHOST);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $delayed_exchange = 'delayed_exchange';
    $delayed_queue = 'delayed_queue';

    $channel->exchange_declare($delayed_exchange, 'x-delayed-message', false, true, false, false, false, new AMQPTable(array(
        'x-delayed-type' => 'direct'
    )));

    $channel->queue_declare($delayed_queue, false, true, false, false, false, new AMQPTable(array(
        'x-message-ttl' => $delay_ms,
        'x-dead-letter-exchange' => $delayed_exchange,
        'x-dead-letter-routing-key' => $delayed_queue
    )));

    $channel->queue_bind($delayed_queue, $delayed_exchange, $delayed_queue);

    $message = new AMQPMessage($message_content, array('delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT));
    $message->set('application_headers', new AMQPTable(array('x-delay' => $delay_ms)));

    $channel->basic_publish($message, $delayed_exchange, $delayed_queue);

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that sends a message to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and the PhpAmqpLib library.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, publishes a message with persistent delivery mode, and then closes the connection. It handles errors gracefully by returning false if an exception occurs.

Input:  
- $messageBody: [string] - The content of the message to be sent  
- $exchange: [string] - The name of the exchange (default: 'router')  
- $queue: [string] - The name of the queue (default: 'msgs')  

Output:  
- [bool] - Returns true if the message was successfully sent, false if an error occurred
matched_results:
<?php
require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;
use PhpAmqpLib\Wire\AMQPTable;

function sendMessageToQueue($messageBody, $exchange = 'router', $queue = 'msgs') {
    $host = 'localhost';
    $port = 5672;
    $user = 'guest';
    $pass = 'guest';
    $vhost = '/';

    try {
        $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
        $channel = $connection->channel();

        $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
        $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
        $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

        $message = new AMQPMessage($messageBody, array('content_type' => 'text/plain', 'delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT));
        $channel->basic_publish($message, $exchange);

        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();

        return true;
    } catch (\Exception $e) {
        return false;
    }
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that publishes messages to a RabbitMQ queue in batches, measuring the total execution time for sending all messages.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares an exchange and queue, then publishes a specified number of messages in configurable batch sizes. It handles connection blocking scenarios and returns the total execution time. A special 'quit' message is sent at the end to signal completion.

Input:
- $msg_count: [integer] - The total number of messages to publish
- $batch_size: [integer] - The number of messages to send in each batch
- $host: [string] - RabbitMQ server hostname
- $port: [integer] - RabbitMQ server port
- $user: [string] - RabbitMQ username
- $pass: [string] - RabbitMQ password
- $vhost: [string] - RabbitMQ virtual host

Output:
- [float] - The total execution time in seconds for sending all messages
matched_results:
<?php
require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;
use PhpAmqpLib\Wire\AMQPTable;

function publishMessages($msg_count, $batch_size, $host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost) {
    $start_time = microtime(true);

    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $channel->exchange_declare('test_exchange', 'direct', false, true, false);
    $channel->queue_declare('test_queue', false, true, false, false, false, new AMQPTable(array('x-max-priority' => 10)));

    $channel->queue_bind('test_queue', 'test_exchange', 'test_routing_key');

    $msg_body = 'message body';
    $msg = new AMQPMessage($msg_body, array('content_type' => 'text/plain', 'delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT));

    for ($i = 0; $i < $msg_count; $i++) {
        $channel->basic_publish($msg, 'test_exchange', 'test_routing_key');
        if (($i + 1) % $batch_size === 0) {
            $channel->wait_for_pending_acks_returns();
        }
    }

    $quit_msg = new AMQPMessage('quit', array('content_type' => 'text/plain', 'delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT));
    $channel->basic_publish($quit_msg, 'test_exchange', 'test_routing_key');

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();

    $end_time = microtime(true);
    return $end_time - $start_time;
}
?>

<?php
require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;
use PhpAmqpLib\Wire\AMQPTable;

function publishMessages($msg_count, $batch_size, $host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost) {
    $start_time = microtime(true);

    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $channel->exchange_declare('test_exchange', 'direct', false, true, false);
    $channel->queue_declare('test_queue', false, true, false, false, false, new AMQPTable(array('x-max-priority' => 10)));

    $channel->queue_bind('test_queue', 'test_exchange', 'test_routing_key');

    $messages = [];
    for ($i = 0; $i < $msg_count; $i++) {
        $body = "Message $i";
        if ($i == $msg_count - 1) {
            $body = "quit";
        }
        $messages[] = new AMQPMessage($body, array('priority' => 1, 'delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT));
    }

    $batch_count = ceil($msg_count / $batch_size);
    for ($batch = 0; $batch < $batch_count; $batch++) {
        for ($i = $batch * $batch_size; $i < ($batch + 1) * $batch_size && $i < $msg_count; $i++) {
            $channel->basic_publish($messages[$i], 'test_exchange', 'test_routing_key');
        }
        $channel->wait_for_pending_acks_returns();
    }

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();

    $end_time = microtime(true);
    return $end_time - $start_time;
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Redis-based session handler class that extends a base session driver and implements the SessionHandlerInterface for use in a web application framework.

Class Description: The CI_Session_redis_driver class provides Redis-based session management functionality, including session data storage, retrieval, locking mechanisms, and cleanup. It handles connection management, session data persistence, and concurrency control through Redis operations.

Attributes:
- _redis: [Redis] - Instance of the Redis client used for all operations
- _key_prefix: [string] - Prefix for all Redis keys used in session storage
- _lock_key: [string] - Key used for the current session lock
- _key_exists: [bool] - Flag indicating whether the current session key exists in Redis
- _config: [array] - Configuration array containing connection parameters and settings
- _session_id: [string] - Current session ID being handled
- _fingerprint: [string] - MD5 hash of the current session data for change detection

Methods:
- __construct(&$params) -> [void] - Constructor that parses configuration parameters and sets up the Redis connection details
- open($save_path, $name) -> [bool] - Opens a connection to the Redis server using configured parameters
- read($session_id) -> [string] - Reads session data from Redis for the given session ID
- write($session_id, $session_data) -> [bool] - Writes session data to Redis for the given session ID
- close() -> [bool] - Closes the Redis connection and releases any locks
- destroy($session_id) -> [bool] - Removes session data from Redis for the given session ID
- gc($maxlifetime) -> [bool] - Garbage collection handler (not implemented for Redis)
- _get_lock($session_id) -> [bool] - Internal method to acquire a lock for session operations
- _release_lock() -> [bool] - Internal method to release the current session lock
- _fail() -> [bool] - Internal method to handle operation failures
- _success() -> [bool] - Internal method to handle operation successes

Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a Redis-based queue management system with connection handling, basic Redis operations, and error recovery mechanisms.

Class Description: The `queue` class is a Redis wrapper that manages connections to Redis servers and provides common Redis operations with automatic reconnection on failure. It supports multiple Redis connections, connection pooling, and prefixing of keys.

Attributes:
- `$redis`: [static, mixed] - Placeholder for Redis instance (deprecated in favor of `$links`)
- `$configs`: [static, array] - Stores configuration for different Redis connections
- `$links`: [static, array] - Maintains active Redis connections
- `$link_name`: [static, string] - Current connection name (defaults to 'default')
- `$prefix`: [static, string] - Default prefix for Redis keys
- `$error`: [static, string] - Stores the last error message

Methods:
- `init()` -> [bool|Redis] - Initializes Redis connection using current configuration. Returns Redis instance or false on failure.
- `set($key, $value, $expire = 0)` -> [bool|null] - Sets a key-value pair in Redis with optional expiration. Returns true on success, null on failure.
- `get($key)` -> [mixed|null] - Retrieves a value by key from Redis. Returns the value or null on failure.
- `del($key)` -> [int|null] - Deletes a key from Redis. Returns number of deleted keys or null on failure.
- `_get_default_config()` -> [array] - Retrieves default Redis configuration from global settings.
- `clear_link()` -> [void] - Closes all active Redis connections and clears the connection pool.

Input:
- Configuration via `$GLOBALS['config']['redis']` for default connection
- Method parameters as described above

Output:
- For connection methods: Redis instance or boolean
- For data operations: Various return types as described above
- Error messages stored in `$error` property

Task Description: Create a Redis cache driver class for CodeIgniter that implements basic cache operations using Redis as the backend storage.

Class Description: The CI_Cache_redis class extends CI_Driver and provides an interface for caching data in Redis. It handles connection management, serialization of complex data types, and standard cache operations like get, save, delete, increment, and decrement.

Attributes:
- $_default_config: [array] - Default configuration for Redis connection
- $_redis: [Redis] - Redis client instance
- $_serialized: [array] - Track which keys contain serialized data

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes Redis connection using configuration
- get($key) -> [mixed] - Retrieves data from cache by key
- save($id, $data, $ttl = 60, $raw = FALSE) -> [bool] - Stores data in cache with optional TTL
- delete($key) -> [bool] - Removes data from cache by key
- increment($id, $offset = 1) -> [int|bool] - Increments a numeric value in cache
- decrement($id, $offset = 1) -> [int|bool] - Decrements a numeric value in cache
- clean() -> [bool] - Clears all cache entries
- cache_info($type = NULL) -> [array] - Returns Redis server information
- get_metadata($key) -> [array|bool] - Returns metadata about a cache entry
- is_supported() -> [bool] - Checks if Redis extension is loaded
- __destruct() -> [void] - Closes Redis connection when object is destroyed

Task Description: Create a Redis wrapper class in PHP that provides a simplified interface for connecting to and interacting with a Redis server, including connection management, basic operations, and error handling.

Class Description: The cls_redis class is a singleton-style wrapper for PHP's Redis extension that manages Redis connections, provides common Redis operations, and handles connection errors gracefully. It supports multiple connection configurations, automatic reconnection on failure, and key prefixing.

Attributes:

Attribute1: protected static $redis - Redis - Singleton Redis instance (deprecated)
Attribute2: protected static $configs - array - Stores Redis connection configurations
Attribute3: private static $links - array - Maintains active Redis connections
Attribute4: private static $link_name - string - Current connection name (default 'default')
Attribute5: public static $prefix - string - Default key prefix ('phpspider')
Attribute6: public static $error - string - Stores last error message

Methods:

Method1: init() -> Redis|false - Initializes and returns a Redis connection instance
Method2: set(string $key, mixed $value, int $expire = 0) -> bool|null - Stores a value in Redis with optional expiration
Method3: get(string $key) -> mixed|null - Retrieves a value from Redis by key
Method4: clear_link() -> void - Closes all active Redis connections
Method5: _get_default_config() -> array - Retrieves default Redis configuration from global settings

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements a Redis client connection using TCP sockets and the phpiredis extension for efficient communication with a Redis server.

- getErrorHandler() -> [callable] - Returns the handler for error responses

Task Description: Implement a Radius class in PHP that handles RADIUS protocol communication for authentication and accounting purposes using UDP sockets.

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using Symfony's HTTP client components to handle HTTP requests and responses.

Class Description: The HttpClientKernel class is an implementation of HttpKernelInterface that provides HTTP client capabilities using Symfony's HTTP client components. It handles HTTP requests by sending them to a remote server and returning the response, supporting various request methods, headers, cookies, and body content (including form data and file uploads).

Attributes:
- client: [HttpClientInterface] - The Symfony HTTP client instance used to send requests

Methods:
- __construct(?HttpClientInterface $client = null) -> [void] - Initializes the HTTP client. If no client is provided, creates a default HttpClient instance. Throws an exception if the HttpClient component is not installed.
- handle(Request $request, int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true) -> [Response] - Processes an HTTP request by sending it to the target server and returns the response. Handles headers, cookies, and request body preparation.
- getBody(Request $request) -> [?AbstractPart] - Prepares the request body content. Returns null for GET/HEAD requests, a TextPart for raw content, or a FormDataPart for form data including file uploads. Throws an exception if the Mime component is not installed when needed.
- getHeaders(Request $request) -> [array] - Extracts and formats headers from the request object, including cookies, into an array suitable for the HTTP client.

Task Description: Implement a UDP scraper class for interacting with BitTorrent trackers to scrape torrent statistics using UDP protocol.

Class Description: UdpScraper is a class that handles communication with BitTorrent trackers via UDP protocol to retrieve scrape information (seeders, leechers, downloads) for given torrent info hashes. It manages socket connections, transaction IDs, and packet formatting according to the UDP tracker protocol.

Attributes:
- currentConnectionId: [string] - The connection ID received from the tracker after initial connection
- transactionId: [int] - The current transaction ID used for request/response tracking
- socket: [resource|null] - The UDP socket resource for communication
- timeout: [int] - Socket timeout in seconds for send/receive operations

Methods:
- scrape([Tracker $tracker, array $hashes]) -> [array] - Main method to scrape multiple torrent hashes by splitting them into chunks
- scrapeChunk([Tracker $tracker, array $hashes]) -> [array] - Scrapes a chunk of torrent hashes (max 74 at a time)
- initSocket() -> [resource] - Initializes and returns a UDP socket
- connect([string $domain, int $port]) -> [void] - Connects the socket to the tracker
- generateTransactionId() -> [void] - Generates a random transaction ID
- startTransaction() -> [void] - Initiates connection with the tracker and establishes connection ID
- scrapeHashes([array $hashes]) -> [array] - Sends scrape request for given hashes and processes response
- request([string $packet, int $readLength]) -> [string] - Sends packet and reads response with timeout
- closeSocket() -> [void] - Closes the socket and resets connection state
- checkError([string $response]) -> [void] - Checks for and handles error responses from tracker

Task Description: Create a PHP function that implements a basic TCP socket server capable of handling client connections, executing commands, and managing directory changes.

Function Description: The function starts a TCP socket server on a specified port, accepts client connections, and provides an interactive shell-like interface. It handles 'cd' commands for directory navigation, 'exit'/'quit' commands for termination, and executes other system commands. The server sends command outputs and current working directory information back to the client.

Input:
- $port: integer - The port number to bind the server socket to
- $wpxf_disabled: array - List of disabled functions/callables
- $wpxf_exec: callable - Function to execute system commands

Output: None (The function runs indefinitely until the client disconnects or sends an exit command)

Task Description: Create a MySQL proxy class that handles communication between a client and MySQL server using Swoole's coroutine client for TCP/UDP communication, implementing authentication and packet handling.

Class Description: MysqlProxy - A class that manages MySQL protocol communication between client and server, handling connection establishment, authentication, packet processing, and error handling.

Attributes:

isDuplex: [bool] - Indicates whether duplex communication is supported by Swoole version
server: [swoole_server] - Swoole server instance
serverFd: [int] - File descriptor of the server connection
charset: [string] - Character set for MySQL communication
account: [array] - MySQL account credentials
auth: [bool] - Authentication status flag
chan: [Swoole\Coroutine\Channel] - Coroutine channel for communication
serverPublicKey: [string] - Server's public key for authentication
salt: [array] - Salt used for password encryption
connected: [bool] - Connection status flag
timeout: [float] - Connection timeout value
mysqlClient: [Swoole\Coroutine\Channel] - Channel for MySQL client communication
mysqlServer: [HandshakePacket] - Server handshake information
client: [Swoole\Coroutine\Client] - Coroutine client instance

Methods:

__construct: [function](swoole_server $server, int $fd, Swoole\Coroutine\Channel $chan) -> [void] - Initializes the proxy with server, file descriptor and channel
connect: [function](string $host, int $port, float $timeout = 0.1, int $tryStep = 0) -> [Client|bool] - Establishes connection to MySQL server with retry logic
onClientReceive: [function](Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli, string $data) -> [void] - Handles incoming data from MySQL server
processAuth: [function](string $pluginName) -> [array] - Processes authentication based on plugin type
send: [function](...$data) -> [bool] - Sends data to MySQL server
recv: [function](&$remain) -> [mixed] - Receives data from MySQL server
onClientClose: [function](Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli) -> [void] - Handles client connection closure
onClientError: [function](Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli) -> [void] - Handles client errors

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements a JSON-RPC client using Swoole's coroutine-based TCP client for asynchronous communication with a JSON-RPC server. The class should handle connection management, request/response serialization, and middleware processing.

Class Description: The Connection class provides a JSON-RPC client implementation using Swoole's coroutine client for TCP communication. It manages the connection lifecycle, handles JSON-RPC protocol serialization/deserialization, and supports middleware processing for requests.

Attributes:
- host: [string] - The hostname or IP address of the JSON-RPC server
- port: [int] - The port number of the JSON-RPC server
- timeout: [float] - Connection timeout in seconds
- callTimeout: [float] - Timeout for RPC calls in seconds
- middleware: [array] - Array of middleware objects to process requests
- client: [Swoole\Coroutine\Client] - The Swoole coroutine client instance (protected)

Methods:
- __construct([array $config = []]) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the connection with optional configuration
- connect() -> [void] - Establishes a TCP connection to the JSON-RPC server
- call([Request $request]) -> [Response] - Sends a JSON-RPC request and returns the response, processing through middleware
- close() -> [void] - Closes the connection to the server
- recv([float $timeout = -1]) -> [string] - Receives data from the server with optional timeout (protected)
- send([string $data]) -> [void] - Sends data to the server (protected)

Task Description: Create a WebSocket server in PHP using stream_socket_server that handles client connections, processes requests, and sends responses.

Class Description: The Server class implements a WebSocket server that listens for incoming connections, handles client requests through callbacks, and manages socket communication. It supports non-blocking operations and provides hooks for custom logic.

Attributes:
- host: string - The host address to bind the server to
- port: int - The port number to listen on
- output: OutputInterface - Interface for debug and status output
- stop: bool - Flag to control server shutdown
- socket: resource - The main server socket resource
- clientSockets: array - Array of connected client sockets
- afterCallback: Closure - Callback executed after server starts
- tickerCallback: Closure - Periodic callback during server loop
- routerCallback: Closure - Request routing callback

Methods:
- __construct(string $host, int $port, OutputInterface $output) -> void - Initializes server with host, port and output interface
- checkRequiredExtensionsExists() -> void - Validates required PHP extensions are loaded
- run() -> void - Starts the server main loop
- createServerSocket() -> resource - Creates and configures the server socket
- updatePort() -> void - Updates the port number from actual socket binding
- acceptNewConnections() -> void - Accepts new client connections
- handleClientRequests() -> void - Processes requests from connected clients
- readClientRequest(resource $clientSocket) -> string - Reads complete request from client
- parseRequest(string $request) -> array - Parses request into path and payload
- sendResponse(resource $clientSocket, Response $response) -> void - Sends formatted response to client
- closeClientSocket(resource $clientSocket, int $key) -> void - Closes and removes client socket
- afterRun(Closure $param) -> void - Sets after-start callback
- ticker(Closure $param) -> void - Sets periodic tick callback
- router(Closure $param) -> void - Sets request routing callback
- stop() -> void - Signals server to stop

Task Description: Create a function that executes a shell command and captures its output using PHP's proc_open for inter-process communication.

Function Description: The function executes a given shell command as a subprocess and returns its standard output. It handles both string and array command formats, manages Windows code page settings if applicable, and ensures proper cleanup of resources. The function returns null if proc_open is unavailable or if process creation fails.

Input: 
- $command: string|array - The shell command to execute, either as a string or array of arguments

Output: 
- ?string - The captured standard output from the command, or null if execution failed

Task Description: Create a function that generates an image from a DOT script using the Graphviz `dot` command-line tool through inter-process communication in PHP.

Function Description: The function takes a DOT script and an image type as input, executes the `dot` command with the specified type, and returns the generated image data. It handles the subprocess communication using pipes for stdin, stdout, and stderr, ensuring proper resource cleanup and error handling.

Input: 
- $dot_script: string - The DOT language script to be processed by Graphviz
- $type: string - The output image type (e.g., 'png', 'svg', 'jpg')

Output: 
- Returns: string - The binary data of the generated image
- On error: Prints error message to stderr and exits the program

Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages a subprocess using proc_open, providing methods to initialize, communicate with, and terminate the process, while handling errors and resource cleanup.

Class Description: The ProcessStream class manages a subprocess execution through pipes for stdin, stdout, and stderr communication. It handles process initialization, error checking, and proper resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- command: string - The command to be executed in the subprocess
- stream: resource - The process resource created by proc_open
- in: resource - The stdin pipe for writing to the subprocess
- out: resource - The stdout pipe for reading from the subprocess

Methods:
- setCommand(string $command) -> void - Sets the command to be executed by the subprocess
- initialize() -> void - Starts the subprocess, sets up communication pipes, and checks for startup errors
- terminate() -> void - Closes all pipes and terminates the subprocess
- getReadConnectionDescription() -> string - Returns a description of the process connection (for logging/debugging)

Task Description: Create a function that retrieves Git tag information from a specified directory using subprocess communication via pipes.

Function Description: The function checks if a given directory is a Git repository (by checking for .git folder) and then executes the 'git describe --tags' command to get the latest tag information. It handles subprocess communication using pipes for stdout and stderr, properly manages resources, and returns the tag information or false if unsuccessful.

Input: 
- $path (string): The filesystem path to check for Git repository information

Output:
- Returns either:
  - (string) The trimmed output from 'git describe --tags' command if successful
  - (bool) false if:
    - The path is not a Git repository
    - The subprocess cannot be created
    - The command returns a non-zero exit code

Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages subprocess execution using proc_open, handling input/output through pipes, with support for timeouts and temporary files.

Class Description: The DefaultPhpProcess class provides functionality to execute subprocesses in PHP using proc_open, managing standard input/output/error streams through pipes. It supports timeout handling, environment variable configuration, and temporary file usage for large inputs.

Attributes:
- tempFile: [string|null] - Path to temporary file used for storing input when needed
- stdin: [string|null] - Standard input content for the subprocess
- env: [array|null] - Environment variables to pass to the subprocess
- timeout: [int|null] - Maximum execution time in seconds before terminating the subprocess

Methods:
- runJob(string $job, array $settings = []): array - Executes a job with optional settings, returns output
  Input: 
    - $job: [string] - The input content for the subprocess
    - $settings: [array] - Additional execution settings
  Output: [array] - Associative array containing 'stdout' and 'stderr' output

- getHandles(): array - Returns additional stream handles for the subprocess
  Output: [array] - Array of stream handles

- runProcess(string $job, array $settings): array - Internal method to execute the subprocess
  Input:
    - $job: [string] - The input content
    - $settings: [array] - Execution settings
  Output: [array] - Associative array containing 'stdout' and 'stderr'

- process(resource $pipe, string $job): void - Writes job content to the input pipe
  Input:
    - $pipe: [resource] - The input pipe resource
    - $job: [string] - Content to write

- cleanup(): void - Cleans up temporary resources (files)
  
- useTemporaryFile(): bool - Determines whether to use temporary files for input
  Output: [bool] - True if temporary files should be used

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using Symfony's HTTP client components to handle HTTP requests and responses.

Class Description: The `HttpClientKernel` class is a Symfony HTTP client implementation that handles HTTP requests by sending them to a server and processing the responses. It supports various request methods, headers, cookies, and body content (including form data and file uploads).

Attributes:
- client: [HttpClientInterface] - The Symfony HTTP client instance used to send requests

Methods:
- __construct([HttpClientInterface $client = null]) -> [void] - Initializes the HTTP client. If no client is provided, creates a new instance. Requires Symfony HTTP client component.
- handle([Request $request], [int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST], [bool $catch = true]) -> [Response] - Processes an HTTP request, sends it using the client, and returns the response. Handles headers, cookies, and request body.
- getBody([Request $request]) -> [AbstractPart|null] - Prepares the request body content. Returns null for GET/HEAD requests, TextPart for raw content, or FormDataPart for form data including files.
- getHeaders([Request $request]) -> [array] - Prepares request headers including cookies from the request object. Returns an array of headers.

Task Description: Create a PHP class that facilitates the execution of shell commands as subprocesses, handling input/output streams, and providing process execution details.

Class Description: The Process class provides a way to execute shell commands as subprocesses, capturing their output streams (stdout and stderr), return codes, and execution time. It includes methods for basic execution and error-checked execution variants.

Attributes:

command: [string] - The shell command to be executed
cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the command execution
env: [array] - Environment variables for the command
descriptors: [array] - Static array defining I/O streams configuration
log_run_times: [bool] - Static flag to enable execution time logging
run_times: [array] - Static array storing command execution time statistics

Methods:

create: [static](string $command, string|null $cwd = null, array $env = []) -> [Process] - Factory method to create a new Process instance
run: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and returns execution details including stdout, stderr, and return code
run_check: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero
run_check_stderr: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero or if stderr contains unexpected output (with specific exception for known PSR-0 deprecation warning)

Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages subprocess execution with proper pipe handling for inter-process communication, including input/output streams and error handling.

Class Description: The Process class provides a way to execute shell commands as subprocesses, capturing their output streams (stdout and stderr) and exit codes. It supports custom working directories and environment variables, and includes optional execution time tracking.

Attributes:
- command: string - The shell command to be executed
- cwd: string|null - The working directory for the command execution
- env: array - Environment variables for the command
- descriptors: array - Static array defining I/O descriptors for proc_open
- log_run_times: bool - Static flag to enable execution time logging
- run_times: array - Static array storing aggregated execution times

Methods:

Task Description: Create a function that executes a shell command in a subprocess and captures its standard output while properly handling resources and errors.

Function Description: The function `readFromProcess` executes a given shell command as a subprocess using PHP's `proc_open`, captures the output from the subprocess's stdout stream, and ensures all resources are properly closed. It handles cases where the `proc_open` function is unavailable or fails to create the subprocess.

Input: 
- `$command` (string): The shell command to be executed in the subprocess.

Output: 
- (string|null): Returns the captured output from the subprocess's stdout if successful, or null if the subprocess could not be created or if `proc_open` is unavailable.

<?php
function readFromProcess($command) {
    if (!function_exists('proc_open')) {
        return null;
    }

    $descriptorspec = array(
        0 => array("pipe", "r"),  // stdin
        1 => array("pipe", "w"),  // stdout
        2 => array("pipe", "w")   // stderr
    );

    $process = proc_open($command, $descriptorspec, $pipes);

    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        return null;
    }

    fclose($pipes[0]); // Close the input pipe as we don't need to send anything to the process

    $output = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[1]);

    $errors = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
    fclose($pipes[2]);

    $return_value = proc_close($process);

    if ($return_value !== 0) {
        return null;
    }

    return $output;
}
?>

Task Description: Create a function that executes a shell command and captures its standard output and error streams using PHP's proc_open.

Task Description: Create a function that executes system commands using various PHP execution methods, with fallback options from most to least preferred, and returns the command output along with execution method information.

Function Description: The function attempts to execute a system command using multiple PHP execution methods in a prioritized order (COM, exec, shell_exec, system, passthru, popen, proc_open). It handles both Windows and Unix-like systems, sets the working directory, and properly manages process pipes and resources. The function returns the command output and indicates which execution method was successful.

Input:
- $cmd: [string] - The system command to be executed

Task Description: Create a PHP helper class for executing system commands and handling inter-process communication using pipes.

Class Description: ProcessHelper is a utility class designed to execute system commands in a cross-platform manner (supporting both Windows and Unix-like systems). It provides a clean interface for running commands, capturing their output and errors, and properly managing process resources.

Methods:

Method1: run(string $command, string $cwd = null) -> array - Executes a system command and returns the exit code, output, and error messages. The method uses proc_open to create pipes for inter-process communication, properly handles resource cleanup, and returns trimmed output strings.

Input:
- $command: [string] - The system command to be executed
- $cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the command (optional)

Output:
- Returns [array] containing three elements:
  1. [int] Exit code of the process (0 typically indicates success)
  2. [string] Standard output from the command (trimmed)
  3. [string] Error output from the command (trimmed)

Throws:
- RuntimeException if the process cannot be started

Task Description: Create a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using cURL with support for various HTTP methods, custom headers, and JSON response handling.

Function Description: The function should initialize a cURL session, configure it based on input parameters, execute the request, handle errors, process the response, and return a structured result including status, headers, and response body. It should support GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, and OPTIONS methods, with options for custom headers, additional cURL options, JSON response parsing, and timeout configuration.

Input:
- $url (string): The target URL for the HTTP request
- $method (string, optional, default='GET'): HTTP method (GET|POST|PUT|DELETE|PATCH|OPTIONS)
- $data (mixed, optional, default=false): Request payload data
- $headers (mixed, optional, default=false): Request headers (string or array)
- $options (mixed, optional, default=false): Additional cURL options as array
- $json (bool, optional, default=false): Whether to parse response as JSON
- $timeout (int, optional, default=3600): Request timeout in seconds

Output:
Returns an associative array containing:
- 'data': Response body (parsed as array if $json=true and valid JSON)
- 'status': Boolean indicating success (HTTP status 200-299)
- 'code': HTTP status code
- 'header': Parsed response headers as associative array

In case of cURL errors:
- 'data': Error message
- 'code': 0
- 'header': cURL info array

<?php

class CurlDownloader {
    private $tempDir;
    private $outputFile;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->tempDir = sys_get_temp_dir();
    }

    public function setTempDir(string $tempDir): void {
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir;
    }

    public function download(string $url): bool {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        if (!$ch) {
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to initialize cURL.");
        }

        $this->outputFile = tempnam($this->tempDir, 'download_');
        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'wb');
        if (!$fp) {
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to open temporary file.");
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 20);

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            fclose($fp);
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException(curl_error($ch));
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        fclose($fp);

        return $result;
    }

    public function getFilename(): string {
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    public function cleanup(): void {
        if (file_exists($this->outputFile)) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
        }
    }
}

<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\GuzzleException;

class Pretreat
{
    private Config $config;

    public function __construct(Config $config)
    {
        if (!isset($config->processNotifyUrl)) {
            throw new Exception('Process notify URL is not configured.');
        }
        $this->config = $config;
    }

    public function process(array $tasks, array $optionalParams = []): array
    {
        $client = new Client(['timeout' => $this->config->timeout]);
        $body = array_merge(['tasks' => $tasks], $optionalParams);
        try {
            $response = $client->post($this->config->endpointUrls['process'], [
                'json' => $body
            ]);
            return json_decode($response->getBody(), true);
        } catch (GuzzleException $e) {
            return ['error' => $e->getMessage()];
        }
    }

    public function query(array $taskIds, string $path): array|bool
    {
        $client = new Client(['timeout' => $this->config->timeout]);
        try {
            $response = $client->get($this->config->endpointUrls[$path], [
                'query' => ['task_ids' => implode(',', $taskIds)]
            ]);
            return json_decode($response->getBody(), true);
        } catch (GuzzleException $e) {
            return false;
        }
    }
}

```php
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\GuzzleException;

class Pretreat
{
    private Config $config;
    private Client $client;

    public function __construct(Config $config)
    {
        if (!isset($config->processNotifyUrl)) {
            throw new Exception('Process notify URL is not configured.');
        }
        $this->config = $config;
        $this->client = new Client([
            'base_uri' => $config->endpoint,
            'timeout' => $config->timeout,
        ]);
    }

    public function process(array $tasks, array $optionalParams = []): array
    {
        $body = array_merge(['tasks' => $tasks], $optionalParams);
        try {
            $response = $this->client->post('/process', [
                'json' => $body,
                'headers' => $this->getHeaders(),
            ]);
            return json_decode($response->getBody(), true);
        } catch (GuzzleException $e) {
            return ['error' => $e->getMessage()];
        }
    }

    public function query(array $taskIds, string $path): array|bool
    {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->get($path, [
                'query' => ['task_ids' => implode(',', $taskIds)],
                'headers' => $this->getHeaders(),
            ]);
            return json_decode($response->getBody(), true);
        } catch (GuzzleException $e) {
            return false;
        }
    }

    private function getHeaders(): array
    {
        return [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer ' . $this->config->apiKey,
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
        ];
    }
}

class Config
{
    public string $endpoint;
    public int $timeout;
    public string $apiKey;
```
    public ?string $processNotifyUrl;

    public function __construct(string $endpoint, int $timeout, string $apiKey, ?string $processNotifyUrl)
    {
        $this->endpoint = $endpoint;
        $this->timeout = $timeout;
        $this->apiKey = $apiKey;
        $this->processNotifyUrl = $processNotifyUrl;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that downloads a file from a specified URL and saves it to a local file using cURL.

Function Description: The function `http_fetch` uses PHP's cURL library to make an HTTP request to a specified URL and writes the response directly to a local file. It includes custom headers (User-Agent and Referer) to mimic a browser request and handles the cURL session lifecycle properly.

Input:
- `$url` (string): The URL of the resource to download
- `$filename` (string): The local file path where the downloaded content should be saved

Output:
- The function does not explicitly return a value, but it writes the downloaded content to the specified file
- The cURL session information is captured in `$ret` but not returned (could be modified to return this if needed)

Task Description: Implement a PHP class for sending notifications through the Pushover.net API using cURL for HTTP requests.

Class Description: The Notifications_Pushover class implements push notification functionality through the Pushover.net service. It handles authentication, message formatting, and API communication to send notifications with different severity levels.

Attributes:
- token: string - The API token/key for Pushover.net authentication
- user: string - The user key for Pushover.net authentication
- priorities: static array - Mapping of priority levels to their string representations

Methods:
- __construct(string $token, string $user) -> void - Initializes the class with API credentials
- static getName() -> string - Returns the service name "pushover.net"
- static getParameters() -> array - Returns required configuration parameters for the service
- notify(string $message, string $severity = 'info', ?string $event = null) -> void - Sends a notification with the given message, severity level, and optional event title

Task Description: The task involves creating PHP functions to interact with a logistics tracking API (kuaidi100.com) to retrieve shipping company information and tracking data for a given tracking number.

Function Description: The code consists of three functions that work together to:
1. Identify the logistics company from a tracking number
2. Retrieve tracking details for the shipment
3. Generate random IP addresses for request headers

Input: 
- For get_company(): A string representing the tracking number ($text)
- For get_data(): Two strings - tracking number ($text) and company code ($com)
- For Rand_IP(): No input parameters

Output:
- get_company(): Returns a string representing the logistics company code
- get_data(): Returns a JSON string containing the tracking information
- Rand_IP(): Returns a string representing a randomly generated IP address

Methods:
1. get_company($text) -> string - Identifies the logistics company from a tracking number by making an HTTP request to kuaidi100.com's autocomplete API and extracting the company code from the response.
2. get_data($text, $com) -> string - Retrieves tracking details for a given tracking number and company code by making an HTTP request to kuaidi100.com's query API.
3. Rand_IP() -> string - Generates a random IP address to be used in request headers for bypassing potential IP-based restrictions.

Note: The functions use cURL for HTTP requests with specific headers and options, including SSL verification disabled, custom user agent, and random IP addresses in headers to mimic browser requests.

Task Description: Create a PHP class that monitors the availability of a URL by periodically checking its HTTP response code until it meets the desired state (available or unavailable) within a specified timeout period.

Class Description: The URLChecker class provides functionality to wait for a URL to become available (returns HTTP 200) or unavailable (returns non-200) within a given timeout period, using cURL for HTTP requests with configurable polling intervals and connection timeouts.

Attributes:
- POLL_INTERVAL_MS: int - The interval in milliseconds between consecutive URL checks
- CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS: int - The connection timeout in milliseconds for each HTTP request

Methods:
- waitUntilAvailable(int $timeout_in_ms, string $url) -> self - Waits until the specified URL returns HTTP 200 status code or throws TimeoutException if not achieved within timeout
- waitUntilUnavailable(int $timeout_in_ms, string $url) -> self - Waits until the specified URL returns non-200 status code or throws TimeoutException if not achieved within timeout
- getHTTPResponseCode(string $url) -> ?int - Private method that makes the actual HTTP request and returns the response code (null if request fails)
matched_results:
<?php

class TimeoutException extends Exception {}

class URLChecker
{
    public const POLL_INTERVAL_MS = 1000;
    public const CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS = 5000;

    public function waitUntilAvailable(int $timeout_in_ms, string $url): self
    {
        $endTime = microtime(true) + ($timeout_in_ms / 1000);
        while (microtime(true) < $endTime) {
            if ($this->getHTTPResponseCode($url) === 200) {
                return $this;
            }
            usleep(self::POLL_INTERVAL_MS * 1000);
        }
        throw new TimeoutException("Timeout reached while waiting for URL to become available.");
    }

    public function waitUntilUnavailable(int $timeout_in_ms, string $url): self
    {
        $endTime = microtime(true) + ($timeout_in_ms / 1000);
        while (microtime(true) < $endTime) {
            if ($this->getHTTPResponseCode($url) !== 200) {
                return $this;
            }
            usleep(self::POLL_INTERVAL_MS * 1000);
        }
        throw new TimeoutException("Timeout reached while waiting for URL to become unavailable.");
    }

    private function getHTTPResponseCode(string $url): ?int
    {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_NOBODY, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT_MS, self::CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT_MS, self::CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS);
        curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $httpCode !== false ? $httpCode : null;
    }
}

<?php

namespace App\Http\Controllers;

use Illuminate\Http\Request;
use Exception;

class ApiExceptAuthController
{
    private $api_controller;
    private $request;

    public function __construct(Request $request)
    {
        $this->request = $request;
    }

    public function callGetApi(string $url): string|bool
    {
        $curl = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);

        $response = curl_exec($curl);
        if (curl_errno($curl)) {
            curl_close($curl);
            return false;
        }

        curl_close($curl);
        return $response;
    }

    public function callPostApi(string $url, mixed $data): string|bool
    {
        $curl = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);

        $response = curl_exec($curl);
        if (curl_errno($curl)) {
            curl_close($curl);
            return false;
        }

        curl_close($curl);
        return $response;
    }
}

?>

<?php

namespace GuzzleClient;

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\GuzzleException;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;

class Guzzle
{
    private $requestArguments = [];
    private $requestHeader = [];
    private $responseBody = '';
    private $responseHeader = [];
    private $responseHttpCode = 0;
    private $responseClientError = null;
    private $responseClientInfo = [];
    private $logger = null;
    private $client;

    public function __construct(Client $client = null, array $config = [])
    {
        $this->client = $client ?: new Client($config);
    }

    public function request(string $uri, string $method, array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false): string
    {
        $this->requestArguments = ['uri' => $uri, 'method' => $method, 'parameters' => $parameters, 'headers' => $headers];
        $this->requestHeader = $headers;

        try {
            $options = $multipart ? ['multipart' => $parameters] : ['form_params' => $parameters];
            $response = $this->client->request($method, $uri, array_merge($options, ['headers' => $headers]));
            $this->responseBody = $response->getBody()->getContents();
            $this->responseHeader = $response->getHeaders();
            $this->responseHttpCode = $response->getStatusCode();
        } catch (GuzzleException $e) {
            $this->responseClientError = $e->getMessage();
            if ($this->logger) {
                $this->logger->error($e->getMessage());
            }
        }

        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponse(): array
    {
        return [
            'headers' => $this->responseHeader,
            'body' => $this->responseBody,
            'status_code' => $this->responseHttpCode,
            'client_error' => $this->responseClientError,
            'client_info' => $this->responseClientInfo
        ];
    }

    public function setLogger(LoggerInterface $logger): void
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function getResponseBody(): string
    {
        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponseHeader(): array
    {
        return $this->responseHeader;
    }

    public function getResponseHttpCode(): int
    {
        return $this->responseHttpCode;
    }

    public function getResponseClientError(): ?string
    {
        return $this->responseClientError;
    }

    protected function getResponseClientInfo(): array
    {
        return $this->responseClientInfo;
    }

    protected function getRequestArguments(): array
    {
        return $this->requestArguments;
    }
}

?>

<?php

class CurlDownloader {
    private $tempDir;
    private $outputFile;

    public function setTempDir(string $tempDir): void {
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir;
    }

    public function download(string $url): bool {
        $this->outputFile = $this->tempDir ?? sys_get_temp_dir() . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . uniqid('download_');
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        if ($ch === false) {
            throw new ErrorException('Failed to initialize cURL session.');
        }

        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'wb');
        if ($fp === false) {
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException('Failed to open temporary file for writing.');
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 20);

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        if ($result === false) {
            fclose($fp);
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            $this->outputFile = null;
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException('cURL error: ' . curl_error($ch));
        }

        fclose($fp);
        curl_close($ch);
        return true;
    }

    public function getFilename(): string {
        if ($this->outputFile === null) {
            throw new RuntimeException('No file has been downloaded yet.');
        }
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    public function cleanup(): void {
        if ($this->outputFile !== null && file_exists($this->outputFile)) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            $this->outputFile = null;
        }

- download(string $url) -> bool - Downloads a file from the specified URL using cURL. Returns true on success, throws ErrorException on failure.

- cleanup() -> void - Removes the downloaded file if it exists.

- For setTempDir(): A string representing the directory path.
- For download(): A string representing the URL to download from.

- For getFilename(): A string representing the path to the downloaded file.
- setTempDir() and cleanup() have no return value.

<?php
class CurlDownloader {
    private $tempDir;
    private $outputFile;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->tempDir = sys_get_temp_dir();
    }

    public function setTempDir(string $tempDir): void {
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir;
    }

    public function download(string $url): bool {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        if ($ch === false) {
            throw new ErrorException('Failed to initialize cURL session.');
        }

        $this->outputFile = tempnam($this->tempDir, 'download_');
        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'wb');
        if ($fp === false) {
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException('Failed to open temporary file for writing.');
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 20);

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        if ($result === false) {
            fclose($fp);
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException('cURL error: ' . curl_error($ch));
        }

        fclose($fp);
        curl_close($ch);

        return true;
    }

    public function getFilename(): string {
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    public function cleanup(): void {
        if (file_exists($this->outputFile)) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
        }
    }
}
?>

<?php

class CurlDownloader {
    private $tempDir;
    private $outputFile;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->tempDir = sys_get_temp_dir();
    }

    public function setTempDir(string $tempDir): void {
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir;
    }

    public function download(string $url): bool {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        if (!$ch) {
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to initialize cURL.");
        }

        $this->outputFile = tempnam($this->tempDir, 'download_');
        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'wb');
        if (!$fp) {
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to open temporary file.");
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 20);

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            fclose($fp);
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException(curl_error($ch));
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        fclose($fp);

        return $result;
    }

    public function getFilename(): string {
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    public function cleanup(): void {
        if (file_exists($this->outputFile)) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
        }
    }
}
